docs.summary: An event that triggers when a loyalty account is created.
description:
The `onAccountCreated()` event handler runs when a loyalty account is created. The received `AccountCreatedEvent` object contains information about the loyalty account that was created.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when the points of a loyalty account are adjusted, earned, or redeemed.
description:
The `onAccountPointsUpdated()` event handler runs when the points of a loyalty account are adjusted, earned, or redeemed. The received `AccountPointsUpdatedEvent` object contains information about the loyalty account that was updated.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when a loyalty account is updated.
description:
The `onAccountUpdated()` event handler runs when a loyalty account is updated. The received `AccountUpdatedEvent` object contains information about the loyalty account that was updated.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

params.name: event
params.doc: Information about the loyalty program that was updated and metadata for the event.

docs.summary: An event that triggers when the name or the point definition of the loyalty program is updated.
description:
The `onProgramUpdated()` event handler runs when the name or the point definition of the loyalty program is updated. The received `ProgramUpdatedEvent` object contains information about the program that was updated.

`onProgramUpdated()` does not trigger when the loyalty program's status changes.

>**Note:** Backend events don't work when previewing your site.

examples.title: An event triggered when a loyalty program is updated
body: // Place this code in the events.js file
// Add the file if it doesn't exist.

Triggered when a reward has been deleted.
Triggered when a reward has been updated.

members.name: sourceAccounts
members.doc: Source accounts.

members.name: updatedAccount
members.doc: Merged account.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Adjusts the account's point balance by this amount. Must be a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits.
The amount can be negative, but cannot be `0`.

Min: `-9,999,999`

Max: `9,999,999`

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Sets the account's point balance to this amount. Must be a positive, whole number or zero.

The net difference between this new balance and the previous balance will be reflected in the `adjusted` field of the customer's account.

Min: `0`

Max: `999,999,999`

members.name: description
members.doc: Description to explain the reason for the points adjustment.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Each time the loyalty account is updated, `revision` increments by 1.

The current `revision` must be passed when adjusting points in the loyalty account. This
ensures you're working with the latest version of the loyalty account and prevents unintended overwrites.

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Adjusts the account's point balance by this amount. Must be a whole number with a maximum of 7 digits.
The amount can be negative, but cannot be `0`.

Min: `-9,999,999`

Max: `9,999,999`

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Sets the account's point balance to this amount. Must be a positive, whole number or zero.

The net difference between this new balance and the previous balance will be reflected in the `adjusted` field of the customer's account.

Min: `0`

Max: `999,999,999`

Contact ID for a Wix site contact. See the Contacts API to
[learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: interval
members.doc: repetitive interval

members.name: oneTime
members.doc: one time

members.name: interval
members.doc: repetitive interval

members.name: oneTime
members.doc: one time

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc:
Amount of points to earn. Must be a positive, whole number.

Min: `1`

Max: `9,999,999`

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

If points were earned manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

members.name: description
members.doc:
Description of how the points were earned.

Max: 100 characters

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc: Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: contactId
members.doc:
Account owner's contact ID or special "me" identifier to get current identity's data.
See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.doc: Amount of earned, adjusted, or redeemed points in the latest transaction.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

Only present if `type` is `EARN` or `ADJUST`.

If points were earned or adjusted manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned or adjusted in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

members.name: description
members.doc: Description of the latest transaction.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc:
nique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

Only present if points were added manually using the [Earn Points endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/earn-points).

members.doc:
Additional information for redeemed points.

Only present if `type` is `REDEEM`.

__Deprecated.__ For `latestTransaction.rewardId`, use `latestTransaction.redeemInfo.rewardId` instead. This property
will be removed on September 30, 2022.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the loyalty account is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the loyalty account.

Ignored when creating an account.

members.name: rewardAvailable
members.doc: Whether the account has a reward available. `true` if the amount of points in `points.balance` are enough to redeem for a reward.

description:
A loyalty account stores a customer's loyalty points balance. A site's customers can earn points to their account
and redeem those points for rewards.

members.name: account
members.doc: Loyalty account.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: Metasite ID.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: adjusted
members.doc: Total adjusted points.

members.name: balance
members.doc:
Current point balance.

Equal to the sum of `earned` and `adjusted` points, minus `redeemed` points.

members.name: earned
members.doc: Total earned points.

members.name: redeemed
members.doc: Total redeemed points.

members.doc: Updated account.

description: Will be published when a subscription is successfully renewed

members.name: referenceEntityId
members.doc:
ID of the specific item that was redeemed in this transaction.

Each reward that is redeemed has a unique `referenceEntityId`.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: ID of the reward that was redeemed.

members.name: rewardType
members.doc: Type of reward that was redeemed.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of times the given reward will be redeemed. Must be a positive whole number.

members.name: referenceEntityId
members.doc: Id of the entity that is being redeemed (e.g. orderId for order discount, couponId for coupon reward).

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time points are redeemed.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing `revision` must be used when redeeming points.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc: Reward ID. See [Rewards API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/loyalty/rewards/rewards-object) for more details.

members.doc: If None, Account belongs to base Tier

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date when the last time Tier was recalculated

members.name: points
members.doc: Points for Tier period (eg. Rolling period for x months). This is equal to the sum of earned and adjusted points for the last x months.

members.doc: If None, Account belongs to base Tier

members.name: numberOfAccounts
members.doc: Total number of loyalty accounts, that belongs to particular Tier

members.name: baseTierDefinition
members.doc: Used to represent base tier

members.name: rollingWindow
members.doc: More periods will be supported in future

members.name: status
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ACTIVE'`
- `'DISABLED'`
- `'DRAFT'`
- `'PAUSED'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`

description: There can be single TiersSettings per site and it's global (i.e. applies to all program's tiers)

members.name: rollingWindow
members.doc: More periods will be supported in future

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time of the transaction.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Transaction ID.

members.name: accountId
members.doc: Loyalty account ID.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Points earned, adjusted, or redeemed in the latest transaction.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that initiated the transaction.

Only present if `type` is `EARN` or `ADJUST`.

If points were earned or adjusted manually, then the `appId` is the Loyalty app's
`wixAppId` of `553c79f3-5625-4f38-b14b-ef7c0d1e87df`. If points were earned or adjusted in an automatic event,
then the `appId` is from that automation's `sourceUniqueId`.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Account owner's contact ID. See the Contacts API to [learn more about a site's contacts](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/contacts/contacts-v4/contact-object).

members.name: description
members.doc: Transaction description. Only present for automated transactions of `type` `EARN` or `REDEEM`, when set by the site owner in the Business Manager.

members.name: idempotencyKey
members.doc:
Unique string identifier generated by the app. Wix uses this identifier to recognize subsequent retries of the same request.

Only present if points were added manually using the [Earn Points endpoint](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-loyalty-program/accounts/earn-points).

members.name: memberId
members.doc: Account owner's member ID. See the Members API to [learn more about a site's members](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/member-object).

members.name: redeemInfo
members.doc: Additional redeem information. Only present if `type` is `REDEEM`.

members.name: rewardId
members.doc:
__Deprecated.__ For `transaction.rewardId`, use `transaction.redeemInfo.rewardId` instead. This property
will be removed on June 30, 2022.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ADJUST'`
- `'EARN'`
- `'GIVE'`
- `'REDEEM'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`

description: Loyalty transaction.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: loyaltyCouponId
members.doc: Id of the LoyaltyCoupon to retrieve

members.name: loyaltyCoupon
members.doc: The retrieved LoyaltyCoupon

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Represents the time this LoyaltyCoupon was created

members.name: _id

members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: filter
members.doc: Filter string (e.g., when {"expired":"true"}, expired coupons will be returned).

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Program status. Customers can only earn or redeem points while the program is `ACTIVE`.

Default: `DRAFT`

description:
A loyalty program allows sites to maintain customer reward accounts. Site owners can create a
loyalty program to increase customer retention. Read more about the loyalty program in
[this overview](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-loyalty-program-an-overview).

members.name: customName
members.doc:
Display name for the program's collectible unit. It's recommended to use the plural, for example
Stars. In contrast to a custom name, the default `"Points"` is translated and adjusted to singular based
on circumstances.

Default: `"Points"`

Max: 20 characters

members.name: originMetaSiteId
members.doc:
A meta site id from which this site was created.

In case of a creation from a template it's a template id.
In case of a site duplication ("Save As" in dashboard or duplicate in UM) it's an id of a source site.

description: Soft deletion of the meta site. Could be restored.
Hard deletion of the meta site.
First publish of a meta site. Or subsequent publish after unpublish.
Rename of the site. Meaning, free public url has been changed as well.

members.name: newOwnerId
members.doc: A new owner id (user that accepts meta site).

members.name: oldOwnerId
members.doc: A previous owner id (user that transfers meta site).

description: Site transferred to another user.
Restoration of the meta site.

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.
